summary: Oliver J. Champion was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications that list Champion's name, position, and salary for various periods between October 1977 and May 1978. These documents confirm Champion's employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Oliver J. Champion's significance lies in their employment with the HSCA, indicating their involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination. The payroll certifications serve as evidence of their role within the committee, though the specific nature of their work is not detailed in these documents.
